model_solution:
Distribute on the left side and the right side.
Combine like terms.
Expand the left side: $2x^2 + 14x - 10x - 35$ and the right side: $2x^2 - x - 10x + 5$.
Combine like terms: $2x^2 + 14x - 10x - 35 = 2x^2 + 4x - 35$ and $2x^2 - x - 10x + 5 = 2x^2 - 11x + 5$.
Subtract the right side from the left side: $(2x^2 + 4x - 35) - (2x^2 - 11x + 5)$.
Distribute the negative sign across the terms of the right side.
Distribute the negative sign across the terms of the right side: $(2x^2 + 4x - 35) - 2x^2 + 11x - 5$.
Combine like terms: $(2x^2 - 2x^2) + (4x + 11x) + (-35 - 5)$.
$(2x^2 - 2x^2) + (4x + 11x) + (-35 - 5) = 0 + 15x - 40$
Combine like terms: $0 + 15x - 40 = 15x - 40$
steps: Distribute on the left side and the right side.
Expand the left side: $2x^2 + 14x - 10x - 35$ and the right side: $2x^2 - x - 10x + 5$.
Subtract the right side from the left side: $(2x^2 + 4x - 35) - (2x^2 - 11x + 5)$.
Distribute the negative sign across the terms of the right side.
Distribute the negative sign across the terms of the right side: $(2x^2 + 4x - 35) - 2x^2 + 11x - 5$.
full_steps: Distribute on the left side and the right side.
Expand the left side: $2x^2 + 14x - 10x - 35$ and the right side: $2x^2 - x - 10x + 5$.
Subtract the right side from the left side: $(2x^2 + 4x - 35) - (2x^2 - 11x + 5)$.
Distribute the negative sign across the terms of the right side.
Distribute the negative sign across the terms of the right side: $(2x^2 + 4x - 35) - 2x^2 + 11x - 5$.
